chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
K: AbsRing

Goal:
forall x y : K, abs (mult x y) <= abs x * abs y

Premises:
mult = fun K : Ring => Ring.mult (AbelianGroup.Pack K (Ring.class K) K) (Ring.class K) : forall K : Ring, K -> K -> K Argument K is implicit and maximally inserted
abs = AbsRing.abs (Ring.Pack K (AbsRing.class K) K) (AbsRing.class K) : K -> R
AbsRing.Mixin : forall (K : Ring) (abs : K -> R), abs zero = 0 -> abs (opp one) = 1 -> (forall x y : K, abs (plus x y) <= abs x + abs y) -> (forall x y : K, abs (mult x y) <= abs x * abs y) -> (forall x : K, abs x = 0 -> x = zero) -> AbsRing.mixin_of K
abs_triangle : forall x y : K, abs (plus x y) <= abs x + abs y
Record mixin_of (K : Ring) : Type := Mixin { abs : K -> R; ax1 : abs zero = 0; ax2 : abs (opp one) = 1; ax3 : forall x y : K, abs (plus x y) <= abs x + abs y; ax4 : forall x y : K, abs (mult x y) <= abs x * abs y; ax5 : forall x : K, abs x = 0 -> x = zero } For Mixin: Argument scopes are [_ function_scope _ _ function_scope function_scope function_scope]
mult_distr_l : forall x y z : ?K, mult x (plus y z) = plus (mult x y) (mult x z) where ?K : [K : AbsRing |- Ring]
mult_assoc : forall x y z : ?K, mult x (mult y z) = mult (mult x y) z where ?K : [K : AbsRing |- Ring]
opp_mult_r : forall x y : ?K, opp (mult x y) = mult x (opp y) where ?K : [K : AbsRing |- Ring]
mult_distr_r : forall x y z : ?K, mult (plus x y) z = plus (mult x z) (mult y z) where ?K : [K : AbsRing |- Ring]
opp_mult_l : forall x y : ?K, opp (mult x y) = mult (opp x) y where ?K : [K : AbsRing |- Ring]
AbsRing.ax4 : forall (K : Ring) (m : AbsRing.mixin_of K) (x y : K), AbsRing.abs K m (mult x y) <= AbsRing.abs K m x * AbsRing.abs K m y
Rabs_mult : forall x y : R, Rabs (x * y) = Rabs x * Rabs y
abs_opp_one = AbsRing.ax2 K (AbsRing.class K) : abs (opp one) = 1
Rle_mult_inv_pos : forall x y : R, 0 <= x -> 0 < y -> 0 <= x * / y
Fourier_util.Rle_mult_inv_pos : forall x y : R, 0 <= x -> 0 < y -> 0 <= x * / y
abs_zero = AbsRing.ax1 (Ring.Pack K (AbsRing.class K) K) (AbsRing.class K) : abs zero = 0
Rmax_left : forall x y : R, y <= x -> Rmax x y = x
Rmax_right : forall x y : R, x <= y -> Rmax x y = y
AbsRing.ax3 : forall (K : Ring) (m : AbsRing.mixin_of K) (x y : K), AbsRing.abs K m (plus x y) <= AbsRing.abs K m x + AbsRing.abs K m y
plus_reg_r : forall r x y : ?G, plus x r = plus y r -> x = y where ?G : [K : AbsRing |- AbelianGroup]
plus_reg_l : forall r x y : ?G, plus r x = plus r y -> x = y where ?G : [K : AbsRing |- AbelianGroup]
Rsqr_incr_0_var : forall x y : R, x² <= y² -> 0 <= y -> x <= y
Rlt_mult_inv_pos : forall x y : R, 0 < x -> 0 < y -> 0 < x * / y
Fourier_util.Rlt_mult_inv_pos : forall x y : R, 0 < x -> 0 < y -> 0 < x * / y
Ring.ax5 : forall (K : AbelianGroup) (m : Ring.mixin_of K) (x y z : K), Ring.mult K m x (plus y z) = plus (Ring.mult K m x y) (Ring.mult K m x z)
Ring.ax1 : forall (K : AbelianGroup) (m : Ring.mixin_of K) (x y z : K), Ring.mult K m x (Ring.mult K m y z) = Ring.mult K m (Ring.mult K m x y) z
Ring.ax4 : forall (K : AbelianGroup) (m : Ring.mixin_of K) (x y z : K), Ring.mult K m (plus x y) z = plus (Ring.mult K m x z) (Ring.mult K m y z)
Rsqr_mult : forall x y : R, (x * y)² = x² * y²
mult_one_l : forall x : ?K, mult one x = x where ?K : [K : AbsRing |- Ring]
plus_zero_l : forall x : ?G, plus zero x = x where ?G : [K : AbsRing |- AbelianGroup]
plus_zero_r : forall x : ?G, plus x zero = x where ?G : [K : AbsRing |- AbelianGroup]
mult_one_r : forall x : ?K, mult x one = x where ?K : [K : AbsRing |- Ring]

```coq
intros x y.
apply AbsRing.ax4.
Qed.
```
